newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent up as NYMEX hits fresh five-year high.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent up as NYMEX hits fresh five-year high.

text.p: SIMEX Brent December futures were firmer in thin trading late on Monday, supported by ongoing worries over heating oil stocks.
December Brent last traded at a contract-high of $24.70 per barrel, up 17 cents from London's settlement of $24.53. Volume was 73 lots.
"It's a continuation of Friday's trend," one broker said, referring to Brent's rally in London. December closed 34 cents up in London.
NYMEX November futures rose to a five-year high of $25.86 on the after-hours ACCESS system and last traded at $25.85. Volume was slight, brokers said.
They pointed to worries over falling heating oil stocks on both sides of the Atlantic and fighting among Kurdish groups in northern Iraq as keeping prices supported.

They said jitters concerning the sacking of Russian President Boris Yeltsin's security chief Alexander Lebed had subsided, but Lebed's long-term threat as a strong presidential rival to Yelstin could support prices.
